member.name: T:FORBES.LOGGER
member.summary: This class creates and manages a event log. It stores the log in a public readonly DataTable and it outputs to the console.

member.name: F:FORBES.LOGGER.CONSOLE_VERBOSE
member.summary: This is the threshold value to output to the console. Any messages with an assigned value higher than this value will not print to the console. Higher value messages will continue to appear in the log.

member.name: F:FORBES.LOGGER.LOG
member.summary: Holds all the messages of the current class instance.

remarks.para: Column 0: Log Name: Name of the log as set by the constructor argument.
Column 1: Shared Entry ID: Entry ID of the message, this value is statically controlled (its shared by all instances of this class).Value will roll over at 16,000,000 and log will reset.
Column 2: Entry ID: The Entry ID of the message. Value will roll over at 16,000,000 and log will reset.
Column 3: IS8601 TimeStamp: DateTime.Now stored in "s" sortable ISO8601 format.
Column 4: Function: The name of the function that called the LOG_MESSAGE method.
Column 5: Verbose Level: The level of the message. This is picked by the programmer, its intended to allow for filtering.
Column 6: Message: The message you wish to write. Note that using string.Format can allow for sending compound messages.
Column 7: Reserved Message Flag: Indicates if the message was one of the class defined reserved messages.

member.name: F:FORBES.LOGGER.UNIFIED_LOG
member.summary: Holds all the messages for all instances of this class.

remarks.para: Column 0: Log Name: Name of the log as set by the constructor argument.

Column 3: IS8601 TimeStamp: DateTime.Now stored in "s" sortable ISO8601 format.

member.name: M:FORBES.MYSQL_COMS.EXECUTE_COMMAND(System.String,FORBES.SQL_PARAMETER[])
member.summary: This method is used to issue database commands. If the command is a hardcoded command, it can be just sent in COMMAND_STRING. If the command string in any way depended on variables or user inputs, a array of parameters should be sent containing those values, otherwise SQL injections may be possible.
member.param: The command you wish to execute.
The parameters you wish to send. See documentation for the SQL_PARAMETER structure for more details.

returns.para: Success: A value greater than or equal to zero. This value represents the number of rows affected.
